SALESFORCE STARTER
Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite

Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite bring sales, service, and marketing functionality together in one app so you get more done in less time. If you’re new to Salesforce or customer relationship management (CRM), Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite offer a simplified experience that’s quick to set up and start using right away. Because it’s built by Salesforce, Starter and Pro Suite can adapt to the unique and changing needs of your business.

What is Salesforce Starter?

Starter is the easiest way for small businesses or people new to Salesforce to get started with a CRM that offers marketing, sales, and service in one suite. Starter provides simple yet powerful tools that enable you to see your data in one place and get a 360-degree view of your customers.

Guided onboarding and suggested actions enable you to quickly and easily import your data and get started with CRM.
Easily gain insight into your pipeline and opportunities with built-in sales stages and prebuilt reports.
Close cases quickly by organizing all your service data in one place.
Target the right audience and maximize your marketing efforts with segmented lists.
What is Salesforce Pro Suite?

Pro Suite is the enhanced CRM suite that offers maturing businesses the increased flexibility and automation you need as your business grows. Get all the convenient setup and ready-to-use tools that come with Starter, plus more automation, customization, and integration options. Whether you’re graduating from Starter or new to Salesforce, Pro Suite helps scale your business and accelerate growth faster than ever.

Tailor your CRM experience and your imported data with custom objects and page layouts.
Extend your CRM to external systems, applications, and data sources with AppExchange and its library of applications.
Automate and streamline processes using approvals and flows.
Gain more insight and predict revenue with advanced sales features such as forecasting.
Automate routing and repetitive tasks to close cases even more quickly.
Learn About Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite
Explore the Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite tools that help you promote your business, close more deals, accelerate growth, and solve customer issues. Our learning map visually guides you through the concepts you need to learn more about Starter and Pro Suite.
Getting Started
Learn how to use sales, service, and marketing features, even if you’re new to Salesforce or customer relationship management. Find and organize your imported data by searching, navigating tabs, and organizing your data. Easily keep information current with intuitive work spaces.
Setup Best Practices
Get Salesforce Starter or Pro Suite ready for your team, even if you’re new to Salesforce or customer relationship management (CRM). Import contacts, connect email accounts, manage sales paths, and invite new users.
Closing More Deals
With Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite, your sales teams have all the data and tools at hand to communicate with prospects and customers, track and manage sales details, and to close more deals fast.
Solving Customer Issues Faster
With Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite, your service teams have all the data and tools they need to help customers, track and manage customer issues, and provide personalized service.
Promote My Business
Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite bring powerful tools into one marketing experience, where you can leverage customer data and engage the people who follow your brand. A streamlined campaign experience brings contacts and content together, while flows enhance and automate your daily tasks.
Managing Your Pro Suite Compliance
If you’re using Pro Suite, you’re responsible for your Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) compliance. Manage your compliance by enabling only HIPAA-covered Salesforce services and features and disabling those that aren’t covered by the Business Associate Addendum (BAA).
How Salesforce Uses Your Data for Business Value Metrics
Salesforce is always working to improve our products. One of the ways we accomplish that goal is to analyze which products and features have the biggest impact on customer success. What we learn lets us improve your product experience to better help you and your business grow.
